channel.title: Planetary Radio: Space Exploration, Astronomy and Science
channel.description: Space exploration, astronomy and planetary science. (Weekly)
channel.itunes:author: Mat Kaplan
channel.itunes:subtitle: Space exploration, astronomy and planetary science. (Weekly)
channel.itunes:summary: Each week, Planetary Radio visits with a scientist, engineer, project manager, advocate or writer who can provide a unique perspective on the quest for knowledge about astronomy, our solar system and beyond. We also showcase regular features that raise your space IQ while they put a smile on your face. Produced by The Planetary Society. Visit our web site for an episode guide and broadcast directory.

item.title: Cassini Project Scientist Linda Spilker With a Saturn Mission Update
item.description: Planetary Radio's most frequent guest returns with the latest news from the great ringed world, its moons, and its rings.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cassini Project Scientist Linda Spilker With a Saturn Mission Update
item.itunes:summary: Planetary Radio's most frequent guest returns with the latest news from the great ringed world, its moons, and its rings.

item.title: Author Kim Stanley Robinson Takes Us to 2312
item.description: Kim Stanley Robinson shares his vision of a brave new solar system 300 years in the future with his new novel, 2312.
item.itunes:subtitle: Author Kim Stanley Robinson Takes Us to 2312
item.itunes:summary: Kim Stanley Robinson shares his vision of a brave new solar system 300 years in the future with his new novel, 2312.

item.title: VIP Tour of a Huge Solar Sail BONUS: Falcon 9 and Dragon Head for the ISS!
item.description: Join the VIP tour! Planetary Radio visited L’Garde, Incorporated to see how its giant solar sail is coming together. You’ll hear from Congressman Dana Rohrabacher, NASA Chief Technologist Mason Peck, and L’Garde co-founder Gordon Veal.
item.itunes:subtitle: VIP Tour of a Huge Solar Sail BONUS: Falcon 9 and Dragon Head for the ISS!
item.itunes:summary: Join the VIP tour! Planetary Radio visited L’Garde, Incorporated to see how its giant solar sail is coming together. You’ll hear from Congressman Dana Rohrabacher, NASA Chief Technologist Mason Peck, and L’Garde co-founder Gordon Veal.

item.title: Visiting the Spacecraft Technology Expo
item.description: Spaceplanes, spacesuits and rockets, oh my! Mat Kaplan talks to exhibitors and others at the first ever Spacecraft Technology Expo in Los Angeles.
item.itunes:subtitle: Visiting the Spacecraft Technology Expo
item.itunes:summary: Spaceplanes, spacesuits and rockets, oh my! Mat Kaplan talks to exhibitors and others at the first ever Spacecraft Technology Expo in Los Angeles.

item.title: Planetary Astronomer Franck Marchis
item.description: Based now at the SETI Institute’s Carl Sagan Center, Franck Marchis recently visited the Planetary Society for a conversation with host Mat Kaplan. He uses several of Earth’s most powerful telescopes to study what he calls multiple asteroid systems.
item.itunes:subtitle: Planetary Astronomer Franck Marchis
item.itunes:summary: Based now at the SETI Institute’s Carl Sagan Center, Franck Marchis recently visited the Planetary Society for a conversation with host Mat Kaplan. He uses several of Earth’s most powerful telescopes to study what he calls multiple asteroid systems.

item.title: Cutting-edge Approaches to Protecting Interplanetary Astronauts
item.description: As if extremes of temperature and lack of air weren’t enough! Some scientists believe it’s space radiation that will keep humans from venturing deep into our solar system. Not so, say three teams of NASA Innovative Advanced Concepts (NIAC)-funded researchers. Each is exploring a cutting-edge approach to protecting astronauts on their way to Mars and other destinations.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cutting-edge Approaches to Protecting Interplanetary Astronauts
item.itunes:summary: As if extremes of temperature and lack of air weren’t enough! Some scientists believe it’s space radiation that will keep humans from venturing deep into our solar system. Not so, say three teams of NASA Innovative Advanced Concepts (NIAC)-funded researchers. Each is exploring a cutting-edge approach to protecting astronauts on their way to Mars and other destinations.

item.title: The Pioneer Anomaly... Solved!
item.description: After decades of mystery and investigation, after the recovery of gigabyte after gigabyte of data stored in obsolete computer formats, the whatdunit surrounding Pioneers 10 and 11 has finally reached its conclusion.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Pioneer Anomaly... Solved!
item.itunes:summary: After decades of mystery and investigation, after the recovery of gigabyte after gigabyte of data stored in obsolete computer formats, the whatdunit surrounding Pioneers 10 and 11 has finally reached its conclusion.

item.title: Taking Back the Night -- International Dark Skies Week
item.description: There are millions of urbanites who have never seen the wonders of a truly dark night sky. Scott Kardel of the International Dark Sky Association is fighting to restore the sky our ancestors knew so well.
item.itunes:subtitle: Taking Back the Night -- International Dark Skies Week
item.itunes:summary: There are millions of urbanites who have never seen the wonders of a truly dark night sky. Scott Kardel of the International Dark Sky Association is fighting to restore the sky our ancestors knew so well.

item.title: Searching for Pandora With Debra Fischer
item.description: Yale exoplanet hunter Debra Fischer is about to begin looking for worlds in the star system that is nearest to Earth. She'll tell us about new technology enabling this effort, and how you can join the search.
item.itunes:subtitle: Searching for Pandora With Debra Fischer
item.itunes:summary: Yale exoplanet hunter Debra Fischer is about to begin looking for worlds in the star system that is nearest to Earth. She'll tell us about new technology enabling this effort, and how you can join the search.

item.title: SETI Scientist Jill Tarter Continues the Search
item.description: The Director of the Center for SETI Research is thrilled to have the Allen Telescope Array back in the hunt for extraterrestrial intelligence. She also tells us about SETILive.
item.itunes:subtitle: SETI Scientist Jill Tarter Continues the Search
item.itunes:summary: The Director of the Center for SETI Research is thrilled to have the Allen Telescope Array back in the hunt for extraterrestrial intelligence. She also tells us about SETILive.

item.title: Big News All Around the Solar System From Emily Lakdawalla
item.description: The 2012 Lunar and Planetary Science Conference attracted many of the world's finest planetary scientists. This year it also attracted Emily Lakdawalla and Bill Nye the Planetary Guy. Emily provides a special report on amazing new discoveries about our solar system.
item.itunes:subtitle: Big News All Around the Solar System From Emily Lakdawalla
item.itunes:summary: The 2012 Lunar and Planetary Science Conference attracted many of the world's finest planetary scientists. This year it also attracted Emily Lakdawalla and Bill Nye the Planetary Guy. Emily provides a special report on amazing new discoveries about our solar system.
